news.title: Mum and children killed in Fermanagh shooting tragedy named locally
news.summary: The tragic victims of what police are investigating as a suspected triple murder and attempted suicide in Co Fermanagh have been named locally as Vanessa Whyte and her children, James and Sara.

news.title: Consumers told to check freezers and not eat meals affected by listeria recall
news.summary: Families have been urged by the food safety watchdog to check their freezers and throw out “implicated” ready-meal products following an outbreak of listeria in which one person has died.

news.title: Donald Trump was told by US Justice Department that he is in the Epstein files, Wall Street Journal reports
news.summary: US Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Donald Trump in May that his name appeared in investigative files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

news.title: All Star Niall Gilligan assault case: An uncomfortable tale involving a child in the wrong place and a man let down by rural decay
news.summary: By all accounts, the jurors did what they were supposed to do. They listened, they weighed up the evidence and they returned the only verdict they reasonably could. The law hadn't asked them to decide if Niall Gilligan was perfect.

news.title: Tánaiste insists EU green light for potential counter-tariffs on €93bn of US goods ‘not escalatory’
news.summary: Tánaiste and Trade Minister Simon Harris has said the approval of the counter-tariffs was not escalatory.

news.title: Keith Byrne sentenced to 15 years in prison for brutal murder of Dublin mum Kirsty Ward at Spanish hotel
news.summary: A former soldier has been jailed for 15 years for the brutal murder of his Irish girlfriend Kirsty Ward at their Spanish holiday hotel.

news.title: Restaurant review: ‘Overall I am disappointed by the food, which simply doesn’t pack as much flavour as it should’
news.summary: Galway International Arts Festival is the busiest two weeks of the year in the city. Shop Street is thronged with luvvies who haven’t seen each other in a while.

news.title: ‘My sister does her fake tan religiously every Thursday night’: Irish women on their love of self tan
news.summary: The long-range forecast for Fiona Brown’s upcoming family summer holiday in France is showing sun and temperatures in the high 20s, but the possibility of coming home with a tan is the furthest thing from her mind – she’s already leaving with one.

news.title: Garda guilty of assaulting teenager (17) in Temple Bar
news.summary: A garda has been convicted of assaulting a teenager in Temple Bar four years ago, following a trial at Dublin Circuit Criminal Court.

news.title: Hungary bans Kneecap from entering country for three years over ‘antisemitic hate speech’ ahead of Sziget Festival show
news.summary: Hungarian authorities have banned Irish rap group Kneecap from entering the country to perform at the Sziget Festival, accusing the band of using antisemitic hate speech and praising the Hamas militant group, a government spokesperson said on Thursday.
